verses.verse: And as He passed <WG3855> by, He saw <WG3708> a man <WG444> blind <WG5185> from birth. <WG1079>

And His disciples <WG3101> asked <WG2065> Him, saying, <WG3004> "Rabbi, <WG4461> who <WG5101> sinned, <WG264> this <WG3778> man <WG3778> or <WG2228> his parents, <WG1118> that he should be born <WG1080> blind <WG5185>?"

Jesus <WG2424> answered, <WG611> "[It was] neither <WG3777> [that] this <WG3778> man <WG3778> sinned, <WG264> nor <WG3777> his parents; <WG1118> but [it was] in order <WG2443> that the works <WG2041> of God <WG2316> might be displayed <WG5319> in him.

"We must <WG1163> work <WG2038> the works <WG2041> of Him who sent <WG3992> Me, as long <WG2193> as it is day; <WG2250> night <WG3571> is coming, <WG2064> when <WG3753> no <WG3762> man <WG3762> can <WG1410> work. <WG2038>
"While <WG3752> I am <WG1510> in the world, <WG2889> I am <WG1510> the light <WG5457> of the world. <WG2889>"
When He had said <WG3004> this, <WG3778> He spat <WG4429> on the ground, <WG5476> and made <WG4160> clay <WG4081> of the spittle, <WG4427> and applied <WG2007> the clay <WG4081> to his eyes, <WG3788>

and said <WG3004> to him, "Go, <WG5217> wash <WG3538> in the pool <WG2861> of Siloam <WG4611>" (which <WG3739> is translated, <WG2059> Sent <WG649>). And so <WG3767> he went <WG565> away <WG565> and washed, <WG3538> and came <WG2064> [back] seeing. <WG991>

The neighbors <WG1069> therefore, <WG3767> and those <WG3588> who previously <WG4387> saw <WG2334> him as a beggar, <WG4319> were saying, <WG3004> "Is not this <WG3778> the one who used to sit <WG2521> and beg <WG4319>?"
Others <WG243> were saying, <WG3004> "This <WG3778> is he," [still] others <WG243> were saying, <WG3004> "No, <WG3780> but he is like <WG3664> him." He kept saying, <WG3004> "I am <WG1510> the one."
Therefore <WG3767> they were saying <WG3004> to him, "How <WG4459> then <WG3767> were your eyes <WG3788> opened <WG455>?"

He answered, <WG611> "The man <WG444> who is called <WG3004> Jesus <WG2424> made <WG4160> clay, <WG4081> and anointed <WG2025> my eyes, <WG3788> and said <WG3004> to me, 'Go <WG5217> to Siloam, <WG4611> and wash <WG3538>' ; so <WG3767> I went <WG565> away <WG565> and washed, <WG3538> and I received <WG308> sight. <WG308>"
And they said <WG3004> to him, "Where <WG4226> is He?" He said, <WG3004> "I do not know. <WG3609>"
They brought <WG71> to the Pharisees <WG5330> him who was formerly <WG4218> blind. <WG5185>
Now <WG1161> it was a Sabbath <WG4521> on the day <WG2250> when <WG3739> Jesus <WG2424> made <WG4160> the clay, <WG4081> and opened <WG455> his eyes. <WG3788>

Again, <WG3825> therefore, <WG3767> the Pharisees <WG5330> also <WG2532> were asking <WG2065> him how <WG4459> he received <WG308> his sight. <WG308> And he said <WG3004> to them, "He applied <WG2007> clay <WG4081> to my eyes, <WG3788> and I washed, <WG3538> and I see. <WG991>"

Therefore <WG3767> some <WG5100> of the Pharisees <WG5330> were saying, <WG3004> "This <WG3778> man <WG444> is not from God, <WG2316> because <WG3754> He does not keep <WG5083> the Sabbath. <WG4521>" But others <WG243> were saying, <WG3004> "How <WG4459> can <WG1410> a man <WG444> who is a sinner <WG268> perform <WG2038> such <WG5108> signs <WG4592>?" And there was a division <WG4978> among <WG1722> them.

They said <WG3004> therefore <WG3767> to the blind <WG5185> man <WG5185> again, <WG3825> "What <WG5101> do you say <WG3004> about <WG4012> Him, since <WG3754> He opened <WG455> your eyes <WG3788>?" And he said, <WG3004> "He is a prophet. <WG4396>"

The Jews <WG2453> therefore <WG3767> did not believe <WG4100> [it] of him, that he had been <WG1510> blind, <WG5185> and had received <WG308> sight, <WG308> until <WG2193> they called <WG5455> the parents <WG1118> of the very <WG846> one <WG846> who had received <WG308> his sight, <WG308>

and questioned <WG2065> them, saying, <WG3004> "Is this <WG3778> your son, <WG5207> who <WG3739> you say <WG3004> was born <WG1080> blind <WG5185>? Then <WG3767> how <WG4459> does he now <WG737> see <WG991>?"
His parents <WG1118> answered <WG611> them and said, <WG3004> "We know <WG3609> that this <WG3778> is our son, <WG5207> and that he was born <WG1080> blind; <WG5185>

but how <WG4459> he now <WG3568> sees, <WG991> we do not know; <WG3609> or <WG2228> who <WG5101> opened <WG455> his eyes, <WG3788> we do not know. <WG3609> Ask <WG2065> him; he is of age, <WG2244> he shall speak <WG2980> for himself. <WG1438> "

His parents <WG1118> said <WG3004> this <WG3778> because <WG3754> they were afraid <WG5399> of the Jews; <WG2453> for the Jews <WG2453> had already <WG2235> agreed, <WG4934> that if <WG1437> anyone <WG5100> should confess <WG3670> Him to be Christ, <WG5547> he should be put <WG656> out of the synagogue. <WG656>
For this <WG3778> reason <WG1223> his parents <WG1118> said, <WG3004> "He is of age; <WG2244> ask <WG2065> him."

So <WG3767> a second <WG1208> time <WG1208> they called <WG5455> the man <WG444> who <WG3739> had been <WG1510> blind, <WG5185> and said <WG3004> to him, "Give <WG1325> glory <WG1391> to God; <WG2316> we know <WG3609> that this <WG3778> man <WG444> is a sinner. <WG268>"

He therefore <WG3767> answered, <WG611> "Whether <WG1487> He is a sinner, <WG268> I do not know; <WG3609> one <WG1520> thing <WG1520> I do know, <WG3609> that, whereas I was blind, <WG5185> now <WG737> I see. <WG991>"
They said <WG3004> therefore <WG3767> to him, "What <WG5101> did He do <WG4160> to you? How <WG4459> did He open <WG455> your eyes <WG3788>?"

He answered <WG611> them, "I told <WG3004> you already, <WG2235> and you did not listen; <WG191> why <WG5101> do you want <WG2309> to hear <WG191> [it] again <WG3825>? You do not want <WG2309> to become <WG1096> His disciples <WG3101> too, <WG2532> do you?"
And they reviled <WG3058> him, and said, <WG3004> "You are His disciple, <WG3101> but we are disciples <WG3101> of Moses. <WG3475>
"We know <WG3609> that God <WG2316> has spoken <WG2980> to Moses; <WG3475> but as for this <WG3778> man, <WG3778> we do not know <WG3609> where <WG4159> He is from."

The man <WG444> answered <WG611> and said <WG3004> to them, "Well, <WG1063> here <WG1722> <WG3778> is an amazing <WG2298> thing, <WG2298> that you do not know <WG3609> where <WG4159> He is from, and [yet] He opened <WG455> my eyes. <WG3788>
"We know <WG3609> that God <WG2316> does not hear <WG191> sinners; <WG268> but if <WG1437> anyone <WG5100> is God-fearing, and does <WG4160> His will, <WG2307> He hears <WG191> him.
"Since <WG1537> the beginning <WG165> of time <WG165> it has never <WG3756> been heard <WG191> that anyone <WG5100> opened <WG455> the eyes <WG3788> of a person <WG5185> born <WG1080> blind. <WG5185>
"If <WG1487> this <WG3778> man <WG3778> were not from God, <WG2316> He could <WG1410> do <WG4160> nothing. <WG3756> <WG3762>"
They answered <WG611> and said <WG3004> to him, "You were born <WG1080> entirely <WG3650> in sins, <WG266> and are you teaching <WG1321> us?" And they put <WG1544> him out.
Jesus <WG2424> heard <WG191> that they had put <WG1544> him out; and finding <WG2147> him, He said, <WG3004> "Do you believe <WG4100> in the Son <WG5207> of Man <WG444>?"
He answered <WG611> and said, <WG3004> "And who <WG5101> is He, Lord, <WG2962> that I may believe <WG4100> in Him?"
Jesus <WG2424> said <WG3004> to him, "You have both <WG2532> seen <WG3708> Him, and He is the one who is talking <WG2980> with you."
And he said, <WG5346> "Lord, <WG2962> I believe. <WG4100>" And he worshiped <WG4352> Him.

And Jesus <WG2424> said, <WG3004> "For judgment <WG2917> I came <WG2064> into this <WG3778> world, <WG2889> that those <WG3588> who do not see <WG991> may see; <WG991> and that those <WG3588> who see <WG991> may become <WG1096> blind. <WG5185>"
Those <WG3588> of the Pharisees <WG5330> who were with Him heard <WG191> these <WG3778> things, <WG3778> and said <WG3004> to Him, "We are not blind <WG5185> too, <WG2532> are we?"

Jesus <WG2424> said <WG3004> to them, "If <WG1487> you were blind, <WG5185> you would have <WG2192> no <WG3756> sin; <WG266> but since <WG3568> you say, <WG3004> 'We see, <WG991>' your sin <WG266> remains. <WG3306>
